Chemical specific information, including hazard and emergency response/exposure considerations, is provided in safety data sheet (SDS). For specific process areas, the facility has documented safety-related limits for specific process parameters such as temperatures, level and composition in the operator procedures manual. The facility maintains the process within these limits by using process controls and monitoring instruments, trained personnel and protective instrument systems such as automated shutdown systems.
The facility also maintains numerous technical documents that provide information about the design and construction of the process equipment. This information includes materials of construction, design pressures, temperature and electrical ratings. This information, in combination with procedures and equipment operating history, provides a basis for inspection and maintenance activities, as well as for evaluating proposed process and facility changes to safety features in the process are not compromised.
C. Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)
Black River Midstream has a comprehensive program to identify and control hazards associated with the RMP covered process. This program systematically exams for potential hazards and puts controls in place to manage hazards. The team identifies, evaluates and makes recommendations to management o

f potential hazards identified. The team's findings are forwarded to Black River Midstream Management for resolution. The approved mitigation options in response to the PHA team's findings are tracked until they are completed. The final resolution of each finding is documented and retained.
The facility periodically updates and revalidates the hazard analysis results. These periodic reviews are conducted at least every 5 years and will be conducted at this frequency until the process is no longer operating. The results and findings from these updates are documented and retained.
D. Operating Procedures
Black River Midstream maintains written Operating Procedures of the covered process that address primary operations mandated by OSHA, EPA, Good Engineering Practice and manufacturers. These procedures can be used as a reference by experienced operators and provide a basis for consistent training of new operators. Procedures are periodically reviewed and annually certified as current accurate by management. The procedures are maintained current and accurate revising them as necessary by employee's suggestion, compliance audit, PHAs, Good Engineering practice, Pre-Startup Safety Review (PSSR) and implemented through Management of Change.
Covered Process Operating procedures are readily available to operators in the process unit and for other personnel to use as necessary to safely perform their job task and maintain the covered process unit operating within its safe limits.
E. Training
Black River Midstream has implemented a comprehensive training program for all employees involved in operating the covered process. New employees receive basic training in process operations if they are not already familiar with such operations. After successfully completing this training, a new operator is paired with a senior operator to learn process-specific duties and tasks. ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
Black River Midstream, LLC owns and operates a natural gas processing plant, the Black River NGPP, in Eddy County, New Mexico.   The plant is designed to process natural gas and recover liquid product from natural gas by physical separation and cryogenic means.  Petroleum condensates are transported onward to another facility for processing.
Black River Midstream, LLC has a long-standing commitment to workers and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our efforts in accident prevention, such as training personnel, quality assurance, and considering safety in the design, installation, operation and maintenance of our process. Our policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances. However if a release does occur, facility trained personnel will evaluate the situation, take actions within the capabilities of the facility, and notify the necessary outside agencies.
DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES
The Black River NGPP is located near Loving, New Mexico and operates a variety of processes to produce the following petroleum products:
1.	NGL
The NGLS within the product surge tank can contain the following regulated chemicals:
a.	Methane
b.	Ethane
c.	Propane
d.	i-Butane
e.	n-Butane
f.	i-Pentane
g.	n-Pentane
GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
A. Employee Participation
Black River Midstream encourages employees to participate in all facets of process safety management and accident prevention as follows:
1. Updating and compiling technical documents and chemical information
2. Performing necessary calculations for PSM and RMP
3. Maintaining good engineering practices
4. Participating as a member of a process hazard analysis (PHA) team
Employees have access to all information pertaining to the accident prevention program.
B. Process Safety Information
Black River Midstream keeps a variety of technical do

heir own, they are allowed to work independently. In addition, all operators periodically receive refresher training on the operating procedures to ensure that their skills and knowledge are maintained at an acceptable level. This refresher training is conducted at least every 3 years, or more frequently upon request. All training is documented for each operator, including the means used to verify and demonstrate skills.
F. Contractors
Black River Midstream uses contractors to supplement its workforce during periods of increased maintenance or construction activities. Because some contractors work on or near Covered Process equipment, the facility has procedures in place to ensure that contractors:
1. Perform their work in a safe manner
2. Have the appropriate knowledge and skills
3. Are aware of the hazards in their workplace
4. Understand what they should do in the event of an emergency
5. Understand and follow site safety rules
6. Inform facility personnel of any hazard that they find during their work
This is accomplished by providing contractors with:
1. A process overview
2. Information about safety and health hazards
3. Emergency response plan requirements
4. Safe work practices before beginning work
In addition, Black River Midstream Management will evaluate the contractor safety program and performance during the selection of a contractor. Facility personnel periodically monitor contractor performance with regard to their safety obligations.
G. Pre-Startup Safety Review
Black River Midstream conducts a PSSR for any new facility modification that requires a change in the process safety information. The purpose of the PSSR is to see that safety features, procedures, personnel and equipment are appropriately prepared for startup before placing the equipment into service. This review provides one additional check that construction is in accordance with the design specifications and that all supporting systems are operationally ready. A PSSR invo

lves field verification of the construction and services as quality assurance verification that the accident prevention program requirements are properly implemented.
H. Safe Work Practices
Black River Midstream has standing safe work practices as mandated by OSHA, EPA, Industrial Standards and Good Engineering Practice in place to help provide employee, public and process safety.
I. Management of Change
Black River Midstream has a comprehensive system to manage changes to all Reported Covered Processes. This system requires that changes to items such as process equipment, chemicals, technology and procedures be properly reviewed and authorized before being implemented. Changes are reviewed to:
1. Determine that adequate controls are in place to manage any new hazards
2. Verify that existing controls have not been compromised by the proposed change
Affected chemical hazard information, process operating limits, and equipment information and procedures are updated to incorporate these changes. In addition, operating and maintenance personnel are trained on the changes.
J. Incident Investigation
Black River Midstream will promptly investigates all incidents related to a covered process that resulted in, or reasonably could have resulted in a fire/explosion, property damage, environmental loss or personal injury. The goal of each investigation will be to determine the facts and develop corrective action to prevent a recurrence of the incident or a similar incident. The investigation team will document its findings, develops recommendations to prevent future occurrences, and forward these results to facility management for resolution. Corrective actions taken in response to the investigation team's findings and recommendations will be tracked until they are complete. The final resolution of each finding or recommendation will be documented and investigation reports will be retained for at least 5 years.
K. Specialized Safety Features
Site specific detection a

nd control equipment (safety features) are deployed throughout the plant to:
1. Contain/control a release
2. Quickly detect a release, and
3. Reduce the consequences of an RMP-regulated substance release
The following type of safety features are used in the covered process:
Release Detection
1. Hydrocarbon and hydrogen sulfide detectors with alarms
Release Containment/Control
1. Process relief valves that discharge to a flare to capture and incinerate episodic releases
2. Automated and manual valves to permit isolation of the process
3. Automated plant shutdown system to shut down all engines, plant utilities and automatically operate
all automatic valves to their fail-safe position, diverting all incoming gas to the emergency flare.
4. Curbing or diking to contain liquids releases
5. Redundant equipment and instrumentation
6. Atmospheric relief devices
Release Mitigation
1. Fire suppression and extinguishing system
2. Trained emergency response personnel
3. Personal protective equipment
4. Blast-resistant building to help protect control systems and personnel
L. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
This plant is a new construction, so Black River NGPP has had no RMP-regulated substance release during the past five years. 
M. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM INFORMATION
The plant maintains a written emergency response plan, which is in place to help protect employees and public safety as well as the environment. The plan identifies steps to be taken in case of an accidental release including: proper first aid and medical treatment for exposures, evacuation plans and accounting for personnel after an evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs.
